title: Short-Intensive Course on Online Program Evaluation and Lifelong Learning Competency Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistical analysis and program evaluation concepts in education
context.additional_context: Teaching competency enhancement program for pre-service/in-service teachers, conducted in BYOD environments for office/administrative professionals, with formative assessment-centered skill development

learning_goals: Prepare a practical case analysis report using program evaluation methodologies (e.g., Kirkpatrick Model).
Participate in and incorporate peer feedback-based collaborative discussions at least three times in mobile learning environments.

Learners can select three core topics (e.g., climate change, AI applications, life sciences) to strengthen lifelong learning competencies in science, establish a personalized learning plan (PLP) with two specific learning goals per topic (e.g., analyzing one paper, conducting one experiment), and submit a weekly execution report (recording over 5 hours of learning time, achieving over 80% progress) within one week.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
